description: Oksana Lintz presents an urgent analysis to the Council, warning that BCI instability will soon become catastrophic. She formally recommends a citywide manual shutdown and reset.

Following Oksana's advice, the Council orders a total shutdown of all BCI-connected systems. Stenograd is plunged into a blackout as digital infrastructure, services, and automated city functions fail. Transit halts, and residents lose all digital access.

Council factions convene emergency in-person crisis meetings for the first time in years, clashing over how to restore order. The Directorate pushes for strict emergency powers; Harmonists urge local empowerment.
With digital systems suspended, neighborhoods self-organize using paper records and local networks. Grassroots leaders emerge to manage essential resources and settle disputes.

The Council announces a temporary power-sharing agreement, promising to restore basic order and utilities. However, new civic alliances begin to challenge their legitimacy as the future of the BCI remains uncertain.
